p: Importantly, after adjustment of age, and secondary dengue virus infection, we still found that febrile phase serum hyaluronan concentration ≥ 70 ng/ml is an independent predictor of occurrence of warning signs (adjusted OR: 2.8, p = .02), as is critical phase serum hyaluronan level ≥ 2700 ng/ml (adjusted OR: 4.0, p < .01) ( Table 1). Thus, serum hyaluronan levels correlate with the severity of the disease.
